sentences.sContent: He’s merely a boy – you can’t expect him to understand.
sentences.sCn: 他只是个孩子——你不要指望他能理解。

sentences.sContent: ...Students do not merely benefit while at university...
...Duncan Watts proposes that the "Mona Lisa" is merely an extreme example of a general rule...
...not merely because it doesn't look good to have a large gap between the rich and the poor...
...Rather than merely asking about something they wanted to try...
...Exaggerated claims merely fuel public distrust and disengagement...
...we should focus on improving our ability but not merely getting a certificate...
...To classify parenting as a personal choice for which there is no collective responsibility is not merely to ignore the social benefits of good parenting; really...
...But a look at the strange variations in tuition reveals that the choice about which college to attend doesn’t come down merely to dollars and cents...

trans.tranOther: used to emphasize how small or unimportant something or someone is
